last_episode_to_air.name: Who's Afraid of Baby Lilah?
last_episode_to_air.overview: Jackson meets baby Lilah, and everyone is surprised by his reaction. Tori struggles with her recovery from the C-section, while Matt and Caryn find new ways to entertain little Jackson. Then, Amy and Chris move one step closer to moving in together.

name: Little People, Big World
overview: Matt & Amy Roloff enlist the help of their four children Jeremy, Zack, Molly & Jacob to help expand the business of Roloff farms. As the kids grow older, the family grows larger and the Roloffs learn how to keep their family relationships strong.

seasons.name: Season 1
seasons.overview: Little people Matt and Amy Roloff may only be four feet tall but they are determined to make the world their own. They're raising four children, a mixture of average and little-sized siblings ages 6-14 - the Roloff's are struggling under emotional and financial burdens. As for the kids, they play with wild abandon on the Roloff's 30-acre farm on the outskirts of Portland Oregon.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: Little People Matt and Amy Roloff may only be four feet tall, but they are determined to make the world their own. Raising four children, a mixture of little- and average-size siblings aged 6 to 15, the Roloffs are struggling under emotional and financial burdens. As for the kids, they play with wild abandon on the Roloff's lush 34-acre farm on the outskirts of Portland, Oregon.

seasons.name: Season 3
seasons.overview: Matt and Amy Roloff may be just 4 feet tall, but viewers soon find themselves looking up to them. The Roloffs juggle a hectic life raising their four children--a mixture of little and average size siblings aged 9-16--along with running their family farm business and startting in a hit television show. Along iwth the usual family squabbles over driving, curfews, and the remotte control, the Roloffs often face the more serious issues when it comes to health problems related to small stature. Little People Big World takes viewers into the world of this family facing the challenges of daily life, both big and small.

seasons.name: Season 4
seasons.overview: The entire Roloff family will be involved in life-changing experiences this season. Matt visits Iraq, and returns with big plans for the farm as the twins prepare to graduate from high school. Molly is cramming for her drivers' license and Jacob hits the field as his focus on soccer grows. Amy learns to let go - she realizes the kids are growing up and she needs to focus on herself, too. The house continues to undergo an extensive renovation, and the family heads to Florida for a much-needed vacation.

seasons.name: Season 5
seasons.overview: The Roloffs are an extraordinary family comprised of both little and average-height people who share with viewers their everyday successes and struggles, presenting an intimate view of life as a little person. In theis season of TLC's hit series Little People, Big World, the family faces Matt's DUI trial--including an intense cross-examination on the witness statnd and growing worries about the verdict. Other episodes this season fouct on Matt and Amy's 20th wedding anniversary, Zach's new average-height girlfriend, and Matt and Amy's cruise during the start of the farm's critical pumpkin season--when long lines, confusion and foul weather push the farm's operations to their limits.

seasons.name: Season 7
seasons.overview: On this season, Matt travels back to Iraq to be there when two young little people receive life-changing surgery. Back home, Molly prepares for graduation, Zach's soccer team dominates, and the entire Roloff family takes an extended vacation, which includes their first ever Mississippi River Boat cruise, as well as a trip to the Gulf Coast to assist with storm relief efforts.

seasons.name: Season 8
seasons.overview: This season, the Roloff family will continue to share their heart-warming moments and real-life challenges. The twins, Zach and Jeremy, are in their final year of high school and wonder if college will be in their futures. Meanwhile, Matt continues to help the Iraqi family that was introduced last season get the medical help they need and Amy's passion for sports lands her a new role as a Dwarf Athletic Association of America Board Member.

seasons.name: Season 10
seasons.overview: Recovering from a serious health scare, Matt Roloff leads his family on a mission to seize the day and live life in a big way. Zach flirts with the notion of dating; Amy attempts to rescue her own health; Jeremy tries his hand at photography; Molly takes over the family store; and Jacob hopes to bond with his brothers before they leave the nest.

seasons.name: Season 11
seasons.overview: The Roloff family is back with a new venture into the wedding business. They have expanded their farm and are turning it into a top-notch wedding venue. Along the way they face their fair share of troubles all while staying focused on their family, as Molly prepares to leave for college and Matt and Amy celebrate their upcoming 25th wedding anniversary.

seasons.name: Season 12
seasons.overview: The Roloffs go back to their roots as children Jeremy, Zack, and Molly join Jacob at home for the summer, reuniting the family on the farm. Matt and Amy will enlist the kids' help as they expand the business and gear up for pumpkin season, and the family works together to plan the most memorable weddings for four new couples who intend to tie the knot at Roloff Farms.

seasons.name: Season 13
seasons.overview: It's springtime and big changes are in bloom at Roloff farm. Matt and Amy put their marital woes aside to keep a united front at Jeremy's graduation; Amy seeks out a business venture of her own by trying her luck in a local restaurant; and Jeremy decides to take his relationship with Audrey to the next level.

seasons.name: Season 14
seasons.overview: After 27 years of marriage, Matt and Amy are still living apart on the farm, and a major life decision is looming. In the midst of their marriage woes, there is also celebration and joy blossoming on the farm. Another big Roloff family wedding is right around the corner...Zach and Tori's!

seasons.name: Season 15
seasons.overview: In this season of Little People, Big World, Matt and Amy Roloff prepare to sign their final divorce papers, and new tensions arise like never before seen on the show. As they embrace their four kids getting older and leading lives of their own, they attempt to live on the same property while managing emotional and operational challenges in order to keep Roloff Farms in the family.

seasons.name: Season 16
seasons.overview: First dates, a potentially fatal surgery, fall-out shelters, and the future of the farm are some of the things the Roloffs will face in a whirlwind of epic events that will surely challenge the family in ways they never could have expected.

seasons.name: Season 17
seasons.overview: This season Zach and Tori Roloff navigate pregnant life leading up to the birth of their first son. Amy is enthusiastically embracing her new role as grandmother and finds herself progressing in her relationship with her boyfriend Chris. Meanwhile, Matt has his own news to reveal that he too is in a relationship.

seasons.name: Season 18
seasons.overview: The future of the farm & family depend on everyone adapting to the major changes that are reshaping the Roloff dynamic every day. Jeremy & Audrey are in a race against time to get everything ready before the baby arrives. With Jeremy working tirelessly to fix up the house, Audrey prepares an ambitious birth plan in which she will deliver the baby without pain medication.

seasons.name: Season 19
seasons.overview: The Roloff family faces life-altering decisions that could reshape their reality when Little People, Big World returns. At the heart of the season lies the fate of Roloff Farms, as Matt and Amy consider if its possible to continue running the property together, while their increasingly separate lives and relationships are driving them further apart. the house.

seasons.name: Season 20
seasons.overview: Its a season of change when Little People, Big World returns. The new episodes usher in an abundance of change for all of the Roloffs; from a pregnancy to farm renovations to a new house and everything in between. Despite the obstacles and occasional disagreements, Matt and Amy do their best to put their ever-changing, modern family first.
